main event: On June 29, 1956, in Southern California from Los Angeles to San Diego, there were sightings of irregular objects that appeared silvery-white and oscillated, lasting for over 2 hours. The conclusion of the investigation pointed to the sighting being caused by a balloon.
interesting points: The observation lasted for approximately 2 hours, allowing for a detailed study of the objects' behavior.

The investigator concluded that the sighting was likely caused by a balloon, supported by reports from the Ontario, California police department and prevalent balloon sightings in the area during the period.
Multiple observers, including ground visual, air visual, and ground electronics, witnessed the event.
Attempts at interception by two F3D aircraft were unsuccessful, as they could not reach the altitude of the object.
The sightings ceased just prior to the reports, and a NOTAM from Ontario, California airport stated that a balloon was observed in the general area at approximately the same time.
sighted object: irregular objects appearing silvery-white and oscillating
location: Southern California, from Los Angeles to San Diego
witnesses: multiple observers, including ground visual, air visual, and ground electronics
photographs: no, the report does not indicate the presence of photographs
